pros: The supervisor is amazing and helpful
cons: I dont have no cons

pros: Decent pay for the area.
cons: Toxic environment Poor management On call alone with a full schedule of patients on weekends. Expect to be there 12-16 hrs on weekends if your on call. Negativity, unhappy employees. Expect nothing you will do will ever be good enough if someone doesn't like you they will make sure that nobody does. Spreading rumors and lies and sabotaging you every step. Best to just leave if this happens to you. Trust me you won't be able to recover. Demoralizing workplace. OT and on call are not paid on top of eachother. So no extra pay to be called in. Just time and half even though your already in overtime. Not enough room to tell it all here.

pros: Employment was close to home
cons: Staffing shortage, and never felt like the company cared much for their employees

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Beckley, WV
pros: PTO, insurance, 401k, shift differential
cons: Hours, holidays, little to no pay raises

pros: Free meals. Great coeworkers. 8 hour shifts.
cons: 30 minute lunches. One 15 minute break. Go let go while on medical leave. Got releasd to go back to work, to find out I was let go.

pros: Cafeteria, good pay for the area. Larger hospital.
cons: Cons are the same you’d expect for any hospital

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Beckley, WV
pros: Good work experience before moving on to better paying jobs.
cons: LPNs do the same job as the RNs and they get paid $10 less an hour and they get all patients the RNs don’t want.

pros:
Great Coworker
Good work environment
Good supervisors
cons:
Short staffed
Inconsistent schedule
Need to rotate shift

pros: Meeting the patients , getting close with them
cons: Not enough pay. Working with girls that they don’t want to work.

pros: Decent pay. The people you work with become family. Patient care is very rewarding.
cons: Can get stressful at times.

pros: Good benefits, people are nice mostly.
cons: Salary and management could be better.

pros: The only positive was RGH was they were the embodiment of everything you don't want as a career.  It was very unpleasant, but It works as a great compass of what not to look for when searching for a job opportunity.
cons: Constant lies by dept. management and HR from the day I interviewed I was mislead by both groups as to my responsibilities and expectations of me.  Favoritism was always shown as certain employees were allowed to come in late or call in "sick" while others were never afforded those leniencies.  Most of the staff had a very rude attitude and were far from hospitable as you would want with nursing staff.

pros: Great people to work with and plenty of opportunities. Great learning experiences. Will work with you on trying to get days off that are requested, but not always guaranteed because of staffing.
cons: Staffing is one of the downfalls.  We are almost always short staffed. Scheduling so many non-consistent days makes it hard to get schooling and other things done.

review_title: patient registrar in Emergency room,outpatient surgery, and admissions
pros: worked in fast paced, quality care facility as a team player. Gained knowledge in medical terminology and proficient in all areas of hospital.
cons: The only cons of working at Raleigh General Hospital is seeing patients and family in traumatic situations and   the first few years of employment was working all shifts and at times overtime was essential.

pros: Love dealing with people of all ages, Learning new things everyday about the medical field. I  have been in the medical field all my life, I would not have it any other way.
cons: Not getting any raises for 2 yrs, understaff, too much favortism.

review_title: Raleigh General Hospital critical care unit
job_title: Intensive Care Unit Registered Nurse in Beckley, WV
pros: Friendly employees with a hometown environment.
cons: It can be extremely stressful in the critical care units.  It is sometimes hard to contact doctors to get orders for extremely ill patients.

pros: Loved talking to the patients
cons: Working your butt off and never appriciaited

pros: Competitive salairies and a great work environment, easy to communicate with Senior Management
cons: Limited growth potential in the organization

pros: Pay is good. Food is very good in the cafeteria
cons: They will work you to death and do nothing but complain. This is the worst place I have ever worked. They give you no time to really clean anything well. Not enough workers on 3rd shift.

pros: Flexible schedule, friendly staff and work environment
cons: Shift rotation, no permanent day shift for floor nursing

pros: Good work environment at times
cons: Co workers lie on you

pros: Teamwork is great within the units
cons: Administration has changed multiple times since employment
